k3nny1550:

lol, I must admit I haven’t seen the film, and only went on what your emoticon suggested.

item.source: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!

item.title: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
Ah, yes. Falling Down almost makes up for Batman and Robin. Almost.

Also, I love all the fake drama the “news” outlets are cooking up over this. They took one quote from a blizzard employee and made it look like all out war, when actually another employee’s response was pretty much “Meh. We’re friends, I’m sure everything’s fine.” But no one is reporting that, of course.

Read full topic

item.source: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!

item.title: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Doedel:

No because it doesn’t make it better you are a fucking moron and I hope you die literally irl

Well that’s certainly mature. I’m glad you have such a reasoned and rational response to such real life issues like disagreement. What do you do when you get stopped at a red light? Go on a massacre?

The wait is only really worth it when it makes a better game; delaying some games because they aren’t ready is worth it (source: Starcraft II, etc.), just because the consequences of releasing unfinished games (source: KotOR 2) are horrible. A lack of progress because you suck (source: Duke Nukem Forever) isn’t a good excuse, because the end product wont be substantially better.

Read full topic

item.source: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!

item.title: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Burbinator:

  1. wow is a good game for what it is: an mmorpg

  2. you sound like people complaining about portal 2 or dota because it supposedly takes time away from ep3

  3. shut up

Yes I have to agree. WoW rocked the MMORPG market in the way only Blizzard can: Completely. I mean seriously, WoW was released in 2004, and almost seven years later still holds 54% of the Western MMO market, and that’s not even counting Asia. If you’re going to make an MMO, you might as well do it right, and Blizzard couldn’t be said to get a lot wrong.

Read full topic

item.source: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!

item.title: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Burbinator:

point taken

just as an aside, to defend Blizzard a bit, the mod community was made possible thanks to Blizzard’s tools and continued support

I don’t think there’s any need to defend Blizzard; they’re either the most, or at least one of, the best video game companies around. Their long-term support is almost unparalleled (source: Warcraft III got its last update in March this year, and Starcraft got one last year; that’s 10 years of support), and the quality of their games…well, that one goes without saying.

Plus, and perhaps more importantly: They support Mac, and have done for decades.

Read full topic

item.source: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!

item.title: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Burbinator:

notice how i also mentioned other things than mods
/logic

Well yes, of course the Blizzard Community is made up of more than just modders. But firstly, a large part of the longevity of the game is derived from a game’s mod-ability (such as, for example, Warcraft III), so they’re hardly an insignificant subset. And secondly, my point was made in response to someone who said talked about the “disgusting Blizzard Community” who made DOTA, so obviously he was talking about the mod-centric aspect of it. While I may have talked generally in response to his odious remarks, there’s no sense including Starcraft players in a discussion about DOTA, since the two aren’t really related, even though they are broadly all part of the nebulous ‘Blizzard Community’.

Read full topic
item.source: New Valve game to be announced tomorrow!
